title: 20-Years-Owned 1987 Porsche 911 Turbo Cabriolet
description: This 1987 Porsche 911 Turbo cabriolet was initially delivered to University Porsche of Seattle, Washington, and it shows 38k miles following the seller's purchase in 2005. Powered by a turbocharged 3.3-liter flat-six paired with a four-speed manual transaxle, the car is finished in black over black leather upholstery. Equipment includes 16" Fuchs alloy wheels, four-wheel cross-drilled and ventilated disc brakes, a limited-slip differential, a black soft top, power-adjustable seats, a Blaupunkt cassette stereo, and air conditioning. This 930 Turbo cabriolet is offered with a window sticker, manufacturer's literature, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Arkansas title.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a 20-Years-Owned 1987 Porsche 911 Turbo Cabriolet at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #197,403.
text: This 1987 Porsche 911 Turbo cabriolet was initially delivered to University Porsche of Seattle, Washington, and it shows 38k miles following the seller’s purchase in 2005. Powered by a turbocharged 3.3-liter flat-six paired with a four-speed manual transaxle, the car is finished in black over black leather upholstery. Equipment includes 16″ Fuchs alloy wheels, four-wheel cross-drilled and ventilated disc brakes, a limited-slip differential, a black soft top, power-adjustable seats, a Blaupunkt cassette stereo, and air conditioning. This 930 Turbo cabriolet is offered with a window sticker, manufacturer’s literature, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Arkansas title. The car is finished in black and front and rear spoilers were standard on the Turbo. Features include a black convertible soft top and fog lights. Close-up photographs of the exterior finish and trim are shown in the gallery below. Forged 16″ Fuchs alloy wheels are mounted with Michelin tires. Braking is handled by four-wheel cross-drilled and ventilated discs, and Turbo models received front and rear sway bars as standard. The power-adjustable front seats are upholstered in black leather. Turbo-branded floor mats line the footwells, and amenities include air conditioning, an analog clock, power windows, and a Blaupunkt cassette stereo. The three-spoke MOMO steering wheel frames VDO instrumentation, including a central tachometer with a 6,700-rpm redline as well as a 170-mph speedometer and gauges for oil pressure, oil temperature, oil level, fuel level, and boost pressure. The six-digit odometer shows 37k miles, approximately 4k of which were added under current ownership. The turbocharged 3.3-liter flat-six was factory rated at 282 horsepower and 278 lb-ft of torque. Power is sent to the rear wheels via a four-speed manual transaxle and a limited-slip differential. The window sticker lists initial delivery to University Porsche of Seattle, Washington, as well as factory colors, equipment, and a total price of $80,186. html:
This 1987 Porsche 911 Turbo cabriolet was initially delivered to University Porsche of Seattle, Washington, and it shows 38k miles following the seller’s purchase in 2005. Powered by a turbocharged 3.3-liter flat-six paired with a four-speed manual transaxle, the car is finished in black over black leather upholstery. Equipment includes 16″ Fuchs alloy wheels, four-wheel cross-drilled and ventilated disc brakes, a limited-slip differential, a black soft top, power-adjustable seats, a Blaupunkt cassette stereo, and air conditioning. This 930 Turbo cabriolet is offered with a window sticker, manufacturer’s literature, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Arkansas title.

The car is finished in black and front and rear spoilers were standard on the Turbo. Features include a black convertible soft top and fog lights. Close-up photographs of the exterior finish and trim are shown in the gallery below.

Forged 16″ Fuchs alloy wheels are mounted with Michelin tires. Braking is handled by four-wheel cross-drilled and ventilated discs, and Turbo models received front and rear sway bars as standard.

The power-adjustable front seats are upholstered in black leather. Turbo-branded floor mats line the footwells, and amenities include air conditioning, an analog clock, power windows, and a Blaupunkt cassette stereo.

The three-spoke MOMO steering wheel frames VDO instrumentation, including a central tachometer with a 6,700-rpm redline as well as a 170-mph speedometer and gauges for oil pressure, oil temperature, oil level, fuel level, and boost pressure. The six-digit odometer shows 37k miles, approximately 4k of which were added under current ownership.

The turbocharged 3.3-liter flat-six was factory rated at 282 horsepower and 278 lb-ft of torque.

Power is sent to the rear wheels via a four-speed manual transaxle and a limited-slip differential.

The window sticker lists initial delivery to University Porsche of Seattle, Washington, as well as factory colors, equipment, and a total price of $80,186.

The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.
